metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: CSS Lists
Unordered Lists:
Ordered Lists:
HTML Lists and CSS List Properties
In HTML, there are two main types of lists:
content.html: In HTML, there are two main types of lists:

content.text: The CSS list properties allow you to:
content.html: The CSS list properties allow you to:

content.text: Different List Item Markers
The list-style-type property specifies the type of list item marker.
content.html: The list-style-type property specifies the type of list item marker.

content.text: The following example shows some of the available list item markers:
content.html: The following example shows some of the available list item markers:

content.code_html:
ul.a {
  list-style-type: circle;
}

ul.b {
  list-style-type: square;
}

ol.c {
  list-style-type: upper-roman;
}

ol.d {
  list-style-type: lower-alpha;
}

content.text: Note: Some of the values are for unordered lists, and some for ordered lists.
content.html: Note: Some of the values are for unordered lists, and some for ordered lists.

content.text: An Image as The List Item Marker
The list-style-image property specifies an image as the list item marker:
content.html: The list-style-image property specifies an image as the list item marker:

content.code_html:
ul {
  list-style-image: url('sqpurple.gif');
}

content.text: Position The List Item Markers
The list-style-position property specifies the position of the list-item markers (bullet points).
content.html: The list-style-position property specifies the position of the list-item markers (bullet points).

content.text: "list-style-position: outside;" means that the bullet points will be outside the list item. The start of each line of a list item will be aligned vertically. This is default:
content.html: "list-style-position: outside;" means that the bullet points will be outside the list item. The start of each line of a list item will be aligned vertically. This is default:

content.text: "list-style-position: inside;" means that the bullet points will be inside the list item. As it is part of the list item, it will be part of the text and push the text at the start:
content.html: "list-style-position: inside;" means that the bullet points will be inside the list item. As it is part of the list item, it will be part of the text and push the text at the start:

content.code_html:
ul.a {
  list-style-position: outside;
}

ul.b {
  list-style-position: inside;
}

content.text: Remove Default Settings
The list-style-type:none property can also be used to remove the markers/bullets. Note that the list also has default margin and padding. To remove this, add margin:0 and padding:0 to <ul> or <ol>:
content.html: The list-style-type:none property can also be used to remove the markers/bullets. Note that the list also has default margin and padding. To remove this, add margin:0 and padding:0 to <ul> or <ol>:

content.code_html:
ul {
  list-style-type: none;
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
}

content.text: List - Shorthand property
The list-style property is a shorthand property. It is used to set all the list properties in one declaration:
content.html: The list-style property is a shorthand property. It is used to set all the list properties in one declaration:

content.code_html:
ul {
  list-style: square inside url("sqpurple.gif");
}

content.text: When using the shorthand property, the order of the property values are:
content.html: When using the shorthand property, the order of the property values are:

content.text: If one of the property values above is missing, the default value for the missing property will be inserted, if any.
content.html: If one of the property values above is missing, the default value for the missing property will be inserted, if any.

content.text: Styling List With Colors
We can also style lists with colors, to make them look a little more interesting.
content.html: We can also style lists with colors, to make them look a little more interesting.

content.text: Anything added to the <ol> or <ul> tag, affects the entire list, while properties added to the <li> tag will affect the individual list items:
content.html: Anything added to the <ol> or <ul> tag, affects the entire list, while properties added to the <li> tag will affect the individual list items:

content.code_html:
ol {
  background: #ff9999;
  padding: 20px;
}

ul {
  background: #3399ff;
  padding: 20px;
}

ol li {
  background: #ffe5e5;
  color: darkred;
  padding: 5px;
  margin-left: 35px;
}

ul li {
  background: #cce5ff;
  color: darkblue;
  margin: 5px;
}

content.question: Which CSS property is used to remove the markers (bullets or numbers) from a list?

content.text: All CSS List Properties

content.code_html:
Property Description
list-style Sets all the properties for a list in one declaration
list-style-image Specifies an image as the list-item marker
list-style-position Specifies the position of the list-item markers (bullet points)
list-style-type Specifies the type of list-item marker
